cons: Cumin suppresses testosterone levels, which means it could make men less fertile if you are taking in large quantity.
description: Cumin has a high content of vitamin E which keeps your skin healthy and glowing.
Topical application of cumin paste on boils, pimples, eczema, psoriasis and other skin disorders facilitates quick healing.
Drinking cumin water can relieve the burning sensation of the palms and the soles.Cumin seeds are very rich in iron, which makes it an essential natural health ingredient.
Cumin seeds are an excellent of iron, a very good source of manganese, and a good source of calcium, magnesium, phosphorus and vitamin B1.
Cumin seeds contain Thymoquinone, which reduces inflammatory processes and other mediators that cause asthma. They also act as a bronchodilator.

Yes, pregnant women can take cumin in moderate amount in your food.
